Hedge Fund Valuation
Hedge fund values are based on market values for traded securities in their portfolios
but must use model (estimated) values for non-traded securities. For traded securities
it is most conservative to use the prices at which a position could be closed: bid prices
for long positions and ask prices for short positions. Some funds use the average of the
bid and ask prices instead. In the case of illiquid securities, quoted market prices may be
reduced for the degree of illiquidity, based on position size compared to the total value
